items.title: This Democrat Lost a Big Race. The Party Is Uneasy About His Return.
items.summary: Mandela Barnes, the former lieutenant governor of Wisconsin, lost a race for Senate in 2022. He is likely to run for governor in 2026, while Democrats are eager for new candidates and new ideas.

items.title: No Education Department? No Problem, Trump’s Education Secretary Says.
items.summary: The shutdown means there is, essentially, no Education Department. The latest round of layoffs would leave few workers to enforce special education and civil rights laws.

items.title: G.O.P. Senators Oppose Trump Watchdog Nominee After Report of Racist Texts
items.summary: At least four Republican senators, including the Senate majority leader, signaled their opposition to Paul Ingrassia, the president’s pick to lead the Office of Special Counsel.

items.title: Biden Completes a Course of Radiation Therapy for Prostate Cancer
items.summary: Former President Joseph R. Biden Jr. began radiation therapy last month for an aggressive form of prostate cancer. It is unclear if his treatment has ended.

items.title: Some States With Democratic Governors Are Posting Partisan Shutdown Messages on Official Websites
items.summary: The messages follow a pattern set by the Trump administration, but use notably milder language.

items.title: Illinois Officials Ask Supreme Court to Keep Block on Trump’s Chicago Troop Deployment
items.summary: A Supreme Court ruling, while technically temporary, could set the ground rules for National Guard deployments elsewhere in the country.

items.title: Police arrest man at Atlanta airport after getting tip he was planning to ‘shoot it up’
items.summary: <p>Police found an assault rifle and ammunition in a Georgia man’s truck after his family had contacted them</p><p>Police arrested a man at <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/atlanta">Atlanta</a>’s bustling airport on Monday after getting a tip from his family that he was planning to shoot up the place – and found an assault rifle and ammunition in his truck outside, the city’s police chief said.</p><p>Billy Joe Cagle, of Cartersville, Georgia, had described his plan to shoot up the world’s busiest airport on a social media livestream, said Darin Schierbaum, the chief of police, during a news conference.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/21/atlanta-airport-arrest">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump to host GOP senators at White House amid demolition work and government shutdown – US politics live
items.summary: <p>The president will host a lunch for Republicans in the Rose Garden as construction is carried out on the White House’s east wing</p><p><strong>The Central Intelligence Agency is providing the bulk of the intelligence used to carry out the controversial lethal air strikes by the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a> against small, fast-going boats in the Caribbean Sea suspected of carrying drugs from Venezuela, according to three sources familiar with the operations.</strong></p><p>Experts say the agency’s central role means much of the evidence used to select which alleged smugglers to kill on the open sea will almost certainly remain secret.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/21/donald-trump-republicans-white-house-ballroom-government-shutdown-troops-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>
